channel.title: Stuck up pures
channel.description:
I know I just made a topic yesterday about runescape. But about 5 minutes ago I was on my pure at duel arena walking around with my red chaps on and bone c'bow. (dorgeshun , or w/e its called...) And I was up to this level 85 pure. I send him a duel challenge for fun he asks me if I want to get owned really badly. I told him chill it was a game. Then he puts his str cape on. I thought , If you think that intimidates then i don't know what the fuck you are smoking. I thought that made him a big nerd. Then he called me a nub and was shouting about how I didn't know how to play the game. I asked him to go outside , because it's fun. He said I needed to go outside.... WHAT??? I told him he needed a life apart from runescape.. he told me that I was a nerd and ran away...
The point of this topic is why do some pures think their the awesome when their really just no lifers that need to exercise and go outside and be active , just like I am going to do after this topic is finished. Why? Their not that great really. Why are mostly pures stuck up? 5/100 pures are nice I would say. Like 2 days ago my clan was going to war this other clan and this level 78 with mage 99 cape and fire cape started flashing it off saying were all noobs . he was actually following us switching between capes calling us noobs!
I would never do this.
Off topic story. This level 80 was asking this level 84 where do I get defenders. I told him I would take him and he said no I was a nub. ... I would have of gladly took him their and he would say ty i would say yw... but no! I would say about 25/100 regular players that are not pure are nice . That is just to me.
WHY ARE THESE DANG PURES SO MEAN AND THINK THEY ARE BETTER1!!!!!!!!

item.title: Stuck up pures
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

[quote=“I Br3ndan I, post:67, topic:192645”]Maybe pures thought about training ‘technically’ when they were first thought of (The first couple of pure accounts - Those guys must’ve been pretty smart), but not now. They just train at the typical spots: rock crabs; experiments. They train there because they’re practically famous spots, and anyone who has good knowledge of RuneScape2 would direct them to those areas if they asked for a good place to train.

Few of them view RuneScape2 as a technical game. Even if they do, main accounts would do so even more due to the fact that they’re training combat alongside every other skill.[/quote]

Theres more to making a good pure than knowing where to train. When I made my level 57 back in the day, I spent some time messing with a combat calculator, considering accuracy and loot, watching people’s max hits and hp to work out how to make a good pure, with what stats at what combat level. I ended up being undefeated in 1 vs 1 except 1 fight and that was because of really bad luck with hits.

Read full topic

item.title: Stuck up pures
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

Yeah, I hate people like that. I see a level 50 who’s done dt and has some 99 skills and goes up to my level 95 main and says “wow ur poor i bet i could pwn u so bad,”. And to my anger, I accept his challenge and end up beating his ass. Not like I’m proud I beat a level 50.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

.Kaboom:

I showed my friend crabs once (hes lvl 80), and pures came up to me and were like “if u were 1 def, id own u”, “lol noob training here ,gtfo”. It was really funny lol

Thats like saying, if you wern’t lvl 126, i would pwn u.

Read full topic

item.title: Stuck up pures
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

I didn’t get that last part. How will you be ‘very smart’ to find out that you can have a high str at a low level? It’s a game for god sakes. Any bit of knowledge can get you far.

Read full topic

item.title: Stuck up pures
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:66, topic:192645”]That doesn’t make sense, pure owners also have to think about the technical side, as they are taking advantage of the combat system, and high level mains think they are great, wear expensive stuff etc.

How about: Pure owners like pvp so they make accounts specially designed for it. k?[/quote]

Maybe pures thought about training ‘technically’ when they were first thought of (The first couple of pure accounts - Those guys must’ve been pretty smart), but not now. They just train at the typical spots: rock crabs; experiments. They train there because they’re practically famous spots, and anyone who has good knowledge of RuneScape2 would direct them to those areas if they asked for a good place to train.

Few of them view RuneScape2 as a technical game. Even if they do, main accounts would do so even more due to the fact that they’re training combat alongside every other skill.

Read full topic

item.title: Stuck up pures
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

[quote=“I Br3ndan I, post:65, topic:192645”]I don’t think any of them would admit it… but I think that they’re extremely into the roleplaying scene. I guess they love their characters and the fact that they’re so cool in comparison to other characters (The majority of these ‘other characters’ being ‘main’ accounts).

‘Main’ accounts view RuneScape2 as a technical game, if you will. They usually think things through before doing them; make the appropriate calculations, requirements, etc.

Pures are therefore much more passionate about the game. This isn’t always so, but I guess this is the typical scenario. They take pride in their superiority, and make their coolness known to everyone who’d compete against it or question it.

This really is just my opinion, and pures here will be able to disagree if they want to, so don’t take these comments as full-proof facts.[/quote]

That doesn’t make sense, pure owners also have to think about the technical side, as they are taking advantage of the combat system, and high level mains think they are great, wear expensive stuff etc.

How about: Pure owners like pvp so they make accounts specially designed for it. k?

Read full topic

item.title: Stuck up pures
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

I don’t think any of them would admit it… but I think that they’re extremely into the roleplaying scene. I guess they love their characters and the fact that they’re so cool in comparison to other characters (The majority of these ‘other characters’ being ‘main’ accounts).

‘Main’ accounts view RuneScape2 as a technical game, if you will. They usually think things through before doing them; make the appropriate calculations, requirements, etc.

Pures are therefore much more passionate about the game. This isn’t always so, but I guess this is the typical scenario. They take pride in their superiority, and make their coolness known to everyone who’d compete against it or question it.

This really is just my opinion, and pures here will be able to disagree if they want to, so don’t take these comments as full-proof facts.

Read full topic

Then again, the average level of a pure isn’t 55, and the average level of a non-pure isn’t 55.

That doesn’t matter. A level 40 pure would have more combat experience than a level 40 main, and a level 80 pure would have more combat experience than a level 80 main. When I said average I meant average stats of that combat, not average combat.
